info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 13 at 7:28PM CDT until April 13 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR RANKIN...EASTERN HINDS AND EASTERN MADISON COUNTIES... At 728 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Byram, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This severe storm will be near... Pearl and Florence around 735 PM CDT. Flowood and Monterey around 740 PM CDT. Brandon around 745 PM CDT. Pelahatchie around 755 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Puckett. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central Mississippi. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
